title.en-US: Creating the future of autonomous transportation

description.en-US: The DAV Foundation, Tel Aviv, created a open source transportation protocol for autonomous vehicles based on blockchain. This protocol will serve as the communication layer for vehicles to vehicles, vehiclesto humans and vice versa. My role within the team isto translate this technology to the human side bycreating applications which show the power of the network. Currently I find my self as part of the R&D team as a UX Engineer. Doing User Experience research, User Interfaces design and develop the application with React Native and JS.

tagline.en-US: Shaping the digital world is what I like and do

description.en-US: Webhooks notify you, another person or system when resources have changed by calling a given HTTP endpoint.

body.en-US:
## What are webhooks?

The webhooks are used to notify you when content has been changed. Specify a URL, configure your webhook, and we will send an HTTP POST request whenever something happens to your content.

## How do I configure a webhook?

Go to Settings → Webhooks from the navigation bar at the top. From there, hit Add webhook, and you will be directed to your new webhook. Then choose a name, put in the information of your HTTP endpoint (URL and authentication), specify any custom headers and select the types of events that should trigger the webhook.

## Why do I get an old version in the CDA?

As the delivery API is powered by a CDN network consisting of hundreds of servers distributed across continents, it takes some time (up to a few minutes) to reflect the changes to the published content. This must be taken into consideration when reacting to webhooks. In normal conditions, there could be a reasonable delay of 2 to 5 minutes.

Extracted from the [Webhooks FAQ](https://www.contentful.com/faq/webhooks/ "Webhooks FAQ").

description.en-US: Your very first content with Contentful, pulled in JSON format using the Content Delivery API.

body.en-US:
These is your very first content with Contentful, pulled in JSON format using the [Content Delivery API](https://www.contentful.com/developers/docs/references/content-delivery-api/ "Content Delivery API"). Content and presentation are now decoupled, allowing you to focus your efforts in building the perfect app.

## Your first steps

Building with Contentful is easy. First take a moment to get [the basics of content modelling](https://www.contentful.com/r/knowledgebase/content-modelling-basics/ "the basics of content modelling"), which you can set up in the [Contentful Web app](https://app.contentful.com/ "Contentful Web app"). Once you get that, feel free to drop by the [Documentation](https://www.contentful.com/developers/docs/ "Documentation") to learn a bit more about how to build your app with Contentful, in particular the [API basics](https://www.contentful.com/developers/docs/concepts/apis/ "API basics") and each one of our four APIs, as shown below.

### Content Delivery API

The [Content Delivery API](https://www.contentful.com/developers/docs/references/content-delivery-api/ "Content Delivery API") (CDA), available at `cdn.contentful.com`, is a read-only API for delivering content from Contentful to apps, websites and other media. Content is delivered as JSON data, and images, videos and other media as files.
The API is available via a globally distributed content delivery network. The server closest to the user serves all content, both JSON and binary. This minimizes latency, which especially benefits mobile apps. Hosting content in multiple global data centers also greatly improves the availability of content.

### Content Management API

The [Content Management API](https://www.contentful.com/developers/docs/references/content-management-api/ "Content Management API") (CMA), available at `api.contentful.com`, is a read-write API for managing content. Unlike the Content Delivery API, the management API requires you to authenticate as a Contentful user. You could use the CMA for several use cases, such as:
* Automatic imports from different CMSes like WordPress or Drupal.
* Integration with other backend systems, such as an e-commerce shop.
* Building custom editing experiences. We built the [Contentful Web app](https://app.contentful.com/ "Contentful Web app") on top of this API.

### Preview API

The [Content Preview API](https://www.contentful.com/developers/docs/concepts/apis/#content-preview-api "Content Preview API"), available at `preview.contentful.com`, is a variant of the CDA for previewing your content before delivering it to your customers. You use the Content Preview API in combination with a "preview" deployment of your website (or a "preview" build of your mobile app) that allows content managers and authors to view their work in-context, as if it were published, using a "preview" access token as though it were delivered by the CDA.

### Images API

The [Images API](https://www.contentful.com/developers/docs/concepts/apis/#images-api "Images API"), available at `images.contentful.com`, allows you to resize and crop images, change their background color and convert them to different formats. Using our API for these transformations lets you upload high-quality assets, deliver exactly what your app needs, and still get all the benefits of our caching CDN.

shortBio.en-US: Research and recommendations for modern stack websites.

description.en-US: Worry less about security, caching, and talking to the server. Static sites are the new thing.

body.en-US:
## The case for the static site generator

More and more developers are jumping on the "go static train", and rightfully so. Static pages are fast, lightweight, they scale well. They are more secure, and simple to maintain and they allow you to focus all your time and effort on the user interface. Often times, this dedication really shows.

It just so happens that static site generators are mostly loved by developers, but not by the average Joe. They do not offer WYSIWYG, previewing on demo sites may take an update cycle, they are often based on markdown text files, and they require some knowledge of modern day repositories.

Moreover, when teams are collaborating, it can get complicated quickly. Has this article already been proof-read or reviewed? Is this input valid? Are user permissions available, e.g. for administering adding and removing team members? Can this article be published at a future date? How can a large repository of content be categorized, organized, and searched? All these requirements have previously been more or less solved within the admin area of your CMS. But of course with all the baggage that made you leave the appserver-app-database-in-one-big-blob stack in the first place.

## Content APIs to the rescue

An alternative is decoupling the content management aspect from the system. And then replacing the maintenance prone server with a cloud based web service offering. Effectively, instead of your CMS of old, you move to a [Content Management as a Service (CMaaS)](https://www.contentful.com/r/knowledgebase/content-as-a-service/ "Content Management as a Service (CMaaS)") world, with a content API to deliver all your content. That way, you get the all the [benefits of content management features](http://www.digett.com/blog/01/16/2014/pairing-static-websites-cms "benefits of content management features") while still being able to embrace the static site generator mantra.

It so happens that Contentful is offering just that kind of content API. A service that

* from the ground up has been designed to be fast, scalable, secure, and offer high uptime, so that you don’t have to worry about maintenance ever again.
* offers a powerful editor and lots of flexibility in creating templates for your documents that your editors can reuse and combine, so that no developers resources are required in everyday writing and updating tasks.
* separates content from presentation, so you can reuse your content repository for any device platform your heart desires. That way, you can COPE ("create once, publish everywhere").
* offers webhooks that you can use to rebuild your static site in a fully automated fashion every time your content is modified.

Extracted from the article [CMS-functionality for static site generators](https://www.contentful.com/r/knowledgebase/contentful-api-cms-static-site-generators/ "CMS-functionality for static site generators"). Read more about the [static site generators supported by Contentful](https://www.contentful.com/developers/docs/tools/staticsitegenerators/ "static site generators supported by Contentful").

introduction.en-US: UX Engineer based in Tel Aviv. Interfacing research, design and technology to shape intuitive digital experiences.

content.value: Daan van der Zwaag is a design technologist based in Amsterdam and Tel Aviv.
Currently building the agency
Devign.it
— offering digital product development & brand and experience design.
Untangling the worlds' most complex problems with human-designed technology.

I am devoted to making technology more human and humans more technological. Untangling complex problems with human-designed technology is what I like and do. Studied in Amsterdam, Seville, and Aarhus. Worked in Tel Aviv and freelance all around the globe. I specialized in making things I haven’t made before. I always go above and beyond. That’s how I grow.

For the past seven years, I had the pleasure to work for design agencies, international brands, and high tech startups. My role in these talented teams shifted from Full Stack Developer, Information System Designer to UI/UX Designer. Currently, I am fully dedicated to growing my company
Devign.it
. We define, design, and develop digital products, identities, and strategies. As a Design Technologist, I translate technological concepts into reality with testable prototypes.

Lately, I was honored being asked as a lecturer at the University of Applied Sciences of Amsterdam and also at Hyper Island Program in Frontend Development in Stockholm. The classes I will teach, vary from Design Systems and Product Design to Frontend Development. Yet, my classes’ core components will always be humans, design, and technology. I thrive on the magic combination of these three elements.
Daan van der Zwaag is a design technologist based in Amsterdam and Tel Aviv.
Currently building the agency
Devign.it
— offering digital product development & brand and experience design.
He aims to untangle the world toughest problems with design and technology.

title.en-US: Your body your data. The future of healthcare.

description.en-US: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet

content.value: The mission

His past years have been a combination of frontend development, digital design, as well as data visualization. But these years have also included a lot of branding, and entrepreneurship.  Whether it’s been experiences, services, or graphics, solving complex problems with design has always been his red line through his activity.
The outcome
In this technological world the goal is to make every digital interaction as human as possible. My interests vary from health/bio tech, working out handstands, to putting chips inside my body.
Project

During my bachelor thesis at CMD Amsterdam, I've redesigned the Dutch healthcare information system. The six months action-oriented research resulted in the prototype 'Fides', created to have world-wide truthful electronic health records without endangering patients' privacy. Powered by Blockchain, secured by NFC Implants and accessed through multiple fluid interfaces. Your body, your data.
Problem
The World Health Organization
found out
that administrative errors account for up to half of all medical errors in primary healthcare. Electronic health records are an approach to solve this problem.

Unfortunately, in the Netherlands, there is no scalable solution for sharing, managing and storing personal Electronic Health Records. I believe user-centered information technology can solve this problem.
Joining the Tel Aviv startup scene

Creating open source applications for the future of autonomous transportation based on blockchain. Part of the R&D team in Tel Aviv. Merging UI/UX Design and a Frontend Engineering. Working with React.js and React Native.
Open source

Creating open source applications for the future of autonomous transportation based on blockchain. Part of the R&D team in Tel Aviv. Merging UI/UX Design and a Frontend Engineering. Working with React.js and React Native.

title.en-US: Digital identity for dance music publisher

content.value: Hey!Listen is a publishing agency for big dance artists. Showcase every artist without telling, instead listening. Worked with the awesome Kirby CMS as a foundation and created a custom front and backend.
Business Academy Aarhus, Denmark - Erasmus+ Exchange Programme - GPA of 8.5/12
Amsterdam University of Applied Sciences - Bachelor of Science - GPA of 7.92/10
Don Quijote Salamanca and Seville (Level A1, A2, B1)
Eerst Christelijk Lyceum — Focussed on Economics and Social studies
Stedelijk Gymnasium — Focused on Latin, Greek and Science

headline.en-US: 3-day Design System workshop at Hyper Island

content.value: During the course 'Design for the User' at the bachelor Frontend Development at Hyper Island Stockholm, I will give a three-day course about Design Systems. Aimed to bridge the gap between developers and designers. Understand concepts such as modular designing, component-based thinking and creative coding.

headline.en-US: Detailed Design at Communication and Multimedia Design

content.value: Coaching and teaching students how to execute concepts in reality — focussing on ideation, iteration, and testing. Leading a class of undergrad students two days in the week. This course is part of the Behavioural design theme semester at Communication and Multimedia Design at the University of Applied Sciences, Amsterdam.

Founded Untouched Studios. Working space and photo studio on the edge of nature in Amsterdam. The project is a collaboration with photographer Rein Kooyman. Together we are offering art direction, branding and high-quality content production. The space is also available for events, photoshoots and rentals.

In 2016, I founded the digital agency focused on digital product development & brand and experience design. Defining digital concepts and ideas through developing and designing it. Currently, there are two interns and a flexible layer of three freelancers working full-time on international projects.

Creating open-source applications based on blockchain. Enabling a decentralized global transportation network. I was part of the R&D team in Tel Aviv. Merging UI/UX Design and a Frontend Development as a UX Engineer. Designed the UI/UX of three applications of a period of 7 months. Implemented the Frontend in React.js and React Native.

Hybrid position between Digital Design and Frontend Development. I was creating responsive websites with HTML5, CSS3, Javascript ES6, SASS, Gulp, PHP, Wordpress API, GIT and Vue.js and implementing complex and experimental frontend animations. Coordinated workflows with external backend development parties.

First and internship and later freelance Frontend Development for fashion brands and E-commerce parties. I worked closely together with U.I. Designers and Backend Development. Focused on interface animations, experimental web design and micro-interactions. Worked with HTML5, CSS3, Javascript, PHP, Gulp, Sass and GIT.

Releasium is an online platform that notifies users when ticket sales of their favourite events start. Startup Bootcamp backed our company in B.Amsterdam. I co-founded Releasium as the design and technical lead. The tasks were varying from creating the visual identity, building the marketing website and implementing the application Frontend.

The Bierkini is a unisex neoprene beer holder that looks like a bikini. Second Kickstarter project in the Netherlands and used as a viral marketing product for the World Championship in Brazil. Unfortunately, we did not reach our Kickstarter goal, and the Dutch soccer team won bronze.
Developing and designing websites with Wordpress and mostly learning the infinite capabilities of the internet. During this time, I worked closely together with the companies clients.

Started DVDZ.Design, my first company and the perfect job next to studying. Offering website development and graphic design. We grew flexible to 4 freelancers. Over two years, we created 60 Wordpress websites.

Creating and executing multiple party concepts, making designs and working behind the bar. Being part of the Club Stalker Family at such a young age (16) has been the foundation for my creative thinking, hard-working, being open-minded and love for music.
In collaboration with worldwide market leader in event streaming
Nomobo TV
we created a digital experience for a silent disco for AXE Music, during Amsterdam Dance Event 2019.

description.en-US: dolor

content.value: The project
I was asked to create a digital book version of a story published by an unknown writer. The website needed to be available in 12 different languages and highly performing on mobile.
The outcome

I created a completely static website with ReactJS and Gastby. Later on we added the open-source headless CMS Netlify so the client could edit and write text without us being in their creative process. The background animations' behaviour is uncertain, because it is randomly generated and constructed in WebGL.
The story was translated in over 8 languages. Designing for RTL and LTR is not only aligning the text on the left, also the UX and thinking direction is flipped.

title.en-US: Connect silent disco with the studio

extensiveDescription.en-US: During our pivot to micro-mobility, we decided to create native iOS and Android applications. So smoothen the transition from ReactJS, we chose to use React Native.

content.value: De Balie is the most known cultural centre in Amsterdam. Hosting political debates, being a film house and restaurant. Not only offline, but now also online. While working at Van Lennep design agency we've created a new website and a more digital identity. My role varied from UX/UI Designer, Project Manager to Frontend Developer.

title.en-US: Strategy and branding for house record label

content.value: Upcoming house label

ANREC is the new label of the talented House DJ Attek. Appearing on international house and techno festivals and top charts in Spotify. Both as a producer and DJ. Tracks of ANREC are listened over 100.000 times.
Brand strategy

Since the start of the label in early 2017 I created the brand strategy. The past years I created multiple album covers, animations, posters, flyers and 3D renders. My work varied from classic graphic design to market research. The result is perfect blend between commercial and underground visuals. The artwork is mostly used on Spotify, Youtube, Apple Music and Soundcloud.

extensiveDescription.en-US: For the upcoming release of the song 'Chemistry' I created a 3D render of a pill, symbolizing the merge of underground and commercial house music. The refracturing of the glass was made possible by an extensive node-based render scene in Blender.
For the release of the song 'Keep the Family Close' I applied Processing filters on the images with custom writting Java code. Later these movements were used in live shows as background animations

On request of Spotify, ANREC curated eacht month a custom playlist 'Underground Deep House'. I created a design system that was part of the ANREC brand scheme, yet unique for the standalone Spotify artworks.
During my time in Tel Aviv, I continued working for ANREC. At that time I became inspired by the brutalist architecture in the Israeli city. This is visible in the design from that period.
The EP 'Walk in the Park' was the first release in our collaboration. We defined the typography back in 2017 and are still variating within the chosen font family.

title.en-US: Reshaping the digital identity of a NYC VC

content.value: Together with communication expert and branding specialist
Roey Tsemah
, we created a new identity for the New York based Venture Capitalist 'Carbon Ventures'. I was responsible for the Frontend Development of the website.
Carbon Emissions
Carbon Ventures is investing in technologies that transform carbon emitting industries. Their portfolio consists of 20+ multi-national startups that are creating sustainable infrastructure.

extensiveDescription.en-US: A key goal in this project was to create a motion guided user experience. The animations are supporting the dynamic rebranding Carbon Ventures got from Play Think Make in 2019. The complete website consists over 30 custom made animations.
Creating a Design System was essential to grow the extensive UI on dekstop and mobile. Working with this modular system created a faster and consistent develompent workflow.

title.en-US: Digital development for research design studio

content.value: RENS is a design research studio based in Eindhoven, the Netherlands. Created the digital visual language together with
Studio&
. My role in this project shifted between frontend development to motion and UX design.

extensiveDescription.en-US: We've let the branding come alive on a digital level by implementing interactive little big details.
To stay in line with the visual language and keep the navigation accesible, we defined the mobile branding to be responsive too.

text.en-US: We create and shape your idea. Varying from native applications to high quality web applications.
We create and shape your idea. Varying from native applications to high quality web applications.
We create and shape your idea. Varying from native applications to high quality web applications.

content.value: An experiment to make boring data attractive. What you see are the streetlights and their mapped data such as height, coordinates and material. Essentially it is one big 3D scatterplot in webVR. Experimenting with Three.js and D3.js to be on the edge of both technologies.

description.en-US: UI of iOS application Mooving
Multiple UI's of iOS application Mooving
Little big details and animations where a important addition to the minimalism
Visual language defined on mobile without loss of navigation accessibility

lorem
With a new application comes a new identity. The previous DAV identity was in line with our future customers. So we redesigned the brand.
lorem

In 2016 I had the opportunity to join the study Innovation & Entrepreneurship for a field trip to Tel Aviv. Two years later, a group of students from Denmark visit DAV Foundation in Tel Aviv. This time I did the lecture together with the CTO, Tal Ater.
As a company, we decided to make a complete pivot from ride-hailing to micro-mobility. We needed to create two new applications for users to unlock our scooters.
After intense testing and user validation, we created an improved Wireflow. By removing unnecessary actions, the User Experience was enhanced.
To improve the development workflow I created a Design System where we could define global styles and rules. This component-based thinking created a smoother transition from design to code.
When I joined DAV Foundation, I redesigned the existing application by making incremental iterations.
lorem

title.en-US: Profile Image - Daan van der Zwaag - Clear

description.en-US:
Design for tomorrow, test today  — A self-proclaimed UX design methodology to connect humans and emerging technology with testable prototypes.

While conducting this research, there was a need for a methodology  A systematic way to tackle problems and shift to phases. Guidance to stay focused on the output without losing vision. In this case, a fitting UX process model could not be found. This sparked the idea to create a custom UX design process. By objectifying own processes and comparing them to proven models, a constant loop of self-reflection was created.
During the research process, paper sketching was invaluable for presenting concepts.

Power to the patient, implant the Electronic Health Records. Decentralize all the data. Give physical access to professionals. I pitched the idea to the second largest hospital in the Netherlands and were told the security risks were too high to start a pilot.

To grasp the full scope of the problem, I integrated multiple field research days at the hospital. The real-life interaction with the current software, patients, and doctors was valuable to understand the human aspect of the problem.

en-US.fileName: Fides - Your body, your data (static slides).mp4

description.en-US: Not yet thinking of the feasibility of a concept. The most ideal situation is to design a complete Dutch eHealth ecosystem from the ground up. Shaping the unthinkable, we present the Dutch electronic health system of the future, including an acronym for the experts to discuss it. The Decentralized Health System (DHS) — The seamless connection between secured health data, through a decentralized network, accessed by the tools of modernity.

title.en-US: Fides: testable prototype - health data manager

description.en-US: Combing previous iterations, prototypes, and concepts. I created the health data manager application Fides. Power to the patient — health data manager* helps you answer these questions regarding your health data stored all over the Netherlands. Gain back controls.

The visual identity of the prototype is inspired by the 1970's SOS Talisman, an amulet made out of plated silver and contains a small folded paper with emergency data. In case of emergency, a first aid responder could open the necklace en see the data.

title.en-US: Portrait - Daan van der Zwaag - 2020 - Blur
